summary: Seasoned manager with extensive experience in continuous improvement, Six Sigma and Lean methodologies, and aviation maintenance. Skilled in leading cross-functional teams, process optimization, and project management, with hands-on experience as an A&P mechanic, aircraft technician, and aviation electronics technician. Strong background in training, documentation, and safety compliance.

experience.title: Manager, Continuous Improvement
experience.description: Utilize Six Sigma and Lean to improve processes across facilities; lead cross-functional teams; manage employees as project leaders for continuous improvement projects; eliminate waste and variation; implement 5S, Kaizen Events, Value Stream Mapping, Cause and Effect Analysis, Process Controls, Visual Controls, Flow production, variation reduction and waste elimination to reduce cycle times and improve profitability.

experience.title: A&P Mechanic / Aircraft Technician
experience.description: Assign work to mechanics; lead and guide activities ensuring maintenance compliance with company policies and FAA regulations; order and track parts; monitor job estimates; provide on-the-job training; verify qualifications of assigned employees.

experience.title: Aviation Technician
experience.description: Troubleshoot mechanical malfunctions of engines; launch and recover aircraft; perform maintenance on time-sensitive parts; perform minor repairs on airframe and engine; perform fuel and defuel of aircraft; engine operational checks upon completion of maintenance.

experience.title: Sales Associate
experience.description: Create shelf displays; provide customers with detailed information; ensure products are properly stocked; maintain cleanliness of sales area; operate cash register; assist other associates; manage displays for games, computers and accessories.

education.degree: BS in Aviation Business Administration with a minor in Safety

certifications: Master Certificate in Six Sigma (Villanova University, 2014)
Certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt (Villanova University, 2015–Present)
FCC GROL (General Radiotelephone Operator license) with ship radar endorsement
FCC Commercial Operators License (Marine Radio Operator Permit)
